examples.sentence: Each dumpling in this basket has exactly 18 pleats.
We check each smartphone with 23 quality tests.
The KFC buckets are priced at 59 yuan each.
These mooncakes cost 28 yuan each.
Each of the Terracotta Warriors has unique facial features.
The pandas each have their favorite bamboo species.
The twin pandas often groom each other.
The teacher remembers each and every student's WeChat ID.
The eager volunteers prepared 1000 dumplings for the elderly.
Her eager smile warmed everyone at the community center.
Freshmen are always eager to explore every corner of the campus.
The puppy's eager eyes followed the meat bun in my hand.
He was eager for approval after his first stand-up comedy show.
The fans waited with eager anticipation for the new album release.
Our intern is such an eager beaver that she finishes tasks before breakfast.
Young parents are always eager for parenting tips from elders.
The panda cub eagerly reached for the bamboo shoot.
Fans eagerly refresh pages during Double 11 pre-sales.
She eagerly collects limited edition milk tea cups.
Grandpa eagerly forwards every health article on WeChat.
The students eagerly awaited the exam cancellation notice.
Tourists eagerly snap photos with the Canton Tower LED display.
The eagerly anticipated new iPhone comes with extra charger fees.

examples.sentence: The eagerness of new employees reminds me of puppies waiting for treats.
Her eagerness to learn Chinese led her to practice writing characters every day.
Fans waited with eagerness for Jay Chou's new album.
The children were full of eagerness to see the pandas.
The eagle swooped down like a drone strike to catch its prey.
Eagles in Xinjiang's Tianshan Mountains often appear in CCTV documentaries.
The golden eagle emblem on police uniforms symbolizes authority.
Ancient Roman military standards often featured eagle designs.
The editor has an eagle eye for spotting grammar mistakes.
China's high-speed rail technology soars like an eagle in the global market.

examples.sentence: The panda cub's ears twitched when it heard bamboo cracking.
She whispered the secret directly into my ear at the hotpot restaurant.
The mayor promised to lend an ear to street food vendors' complaints.
Give your ear to the erhu music floating from the teahouse.
The musician has a golden ear for Peking opera rhythms.
My grandma's ear isn't what it used to be since the square dancing got louder.
The wheat ears in Xinjiang fields sway like golden waves.
Each ear of corn in the Northeast can grow as long as a forearm.
The rice begins to ear after the Dragon Boat Festival rains.
These special barley ears earlier than usual this year.
Let's play it by ear for the KTV song list tonight.
The delivery app CEO has the mayor's ear about bicycle parking issues.

examples.sentence: The kid's earache turned out to be caused by stuffing a Lego piece in his ear.

examples.sentence: The pop singer's eardrum vibrated like crazy during the concert.
When diving, pressure changes can make your eardrums go 'pop' like bubble wrap.
Doctors use otoscopes to check your eardrum's health status.
The boy's eardrum reflected light like a tiny mirror when the doctor looked inside.
The reporter got an earful about the celebrity's secret wedding.
She gave me an earful of the upcoming iPhone 16 leaks.
Aunt Li always shares an earful of neighborhood gossip.
WeChat groups often deliver an earful of unverified news.
The boss gave him an earful for missing the deadline.
Mom gave me an earful when she found my test score.

examples.sentence: The Earl of Sandwich invented the convenient meal that bears his name.
In Downton Abbey, the Earl of Grantham owns vast tea plantations.
She always starts her day with a cup of Earl Grey and Weibo updates.
This Earl Grey ice cream tastes like liquid aristocracy!

examples.sentence: Her diamond earrings dangled from delicate earlobes.
Grandma pinched my earlobes for good luck during Spring Festival.
Babies' soft earlobes feel like marshmallows.
Early birds can eat the best jianbing at 6am.
The early Tang Dynasty was the golden age of Chinese poetry.
This early watermelon variety can hit the market before Dragon Boat Festival.
Her early talent for Peking opera amazed the neighborhood.
Delivery guys start working as early as roosters crow.
Weibo servers crash early during celebrity gossip storms.
Douyin early focused on 15-second music videos.
The project was promising early but failed later.
Early birds get 50% off breakfast at this Shanghai store.
Early on, Alibaba was just an English tutorial site.

examples.sentence: The black earmark on this sheep identifies it as Mr. Wang's property.
Ancient Egyptian paintings show cattle with elaborate earmarks.
The earmark of this antique is its dragon-shaped handle.
Spicy flavor is the earmark of Sichuan hotpot.
Farmers earmark newborn lambs with colored tags.
The librarian earmarked damaged books with red stickers.
The government earmarked funds for rural education.
This room is earmarked for quarantine use.
The earmarked funds for poverty alleviation cannot be used elsewhere.
This counterfeit bear the earmark of rushed production.

examples.sentence: The government has earmarked 5 billion yuan for panda conservation.
My year-end bonus was earmarked for my daughter's piano lessons.
The earmarked funds for rural education cannot be used to build offices.

examples.sentence: She earns her living by live-streaming spicy hotpot challenges.
A panda keeper earns less than a tech worker but gets more hugs.
The viral Douyin video earned her 10 million followers overnight.
Winning three gold medals earned him free hotpot for life in Chongqing.
His stand-up comedy about gaokao earned thunderous applause.
The grandma's spicy hotpot recipe earned nationwide fame.
The panda cub started earning its keep by starring in documentaries at age two.
He earns his crust by teaching foreigners to use chopsticks.
Her earned vacation days are as precious as panda cubs.
The street performer put his earned coins into a Hello Kitty piggy bank.
He spent his hard-earned money on a bubble tea franchise.
My hard-earned salary disappears faster than hotpot ingredients.
The gig economy has created many flexible earners.
As the top earner in her family, she supports three generations.
The panda dad became the sole breadwinner after his wife's resignation.
Live-streamers can become million-dollar earners overnight.
He paid $500 earnest money to secure the Peking courtyard house.
The earnest for this antique jade is non-refundable.
Her eyes shone with the earnest of a true believer.
The treaty was signed in dead earnest.
There's an earnest in his calligraphy practice that moves me.
Her earnest in learning Sichuan cooking is admirable.
The earnest young doctor checked my pulse three times.
His earnest attempt at making dumplings ended in delicious chaos.
The earnest volunteers helped rebuild the earthquake-stricken village.
Her earnest support for traditional crafts is well-known.
This is an earnest matter concerning food safety.
The CEO spoke with earnest urgency about the company's future.
After failing the test, he began studying in earnest.
The construction work started in earnest after Spring Festival.
The diplomat earnestly apologized for the cultural misunderstanding.
He earnestly promised to return the borrowed hotpot set before Mid-Autumn Festival.
Freshmen earnestly take notes during military training lectures.
She earnestly practiced making dumplings for three months before Spring Festival.
"I'll definitely finish this PPT tonight," he said earnestly while ordering his fifth coffee.
The earnestness in her eyes when solving math problems could melt glaciers.
His earnestness in practicing calligraphy left ink stains all over the bedsheet.
The puppy's earnestness in bringing slippers made everyone forgive its chewed shoes.
She accepted his proposal because of the earnestness in his trembling voice.
The comedian suddenly spoke with an earnestness that shocked the audience.
His face lost all earnestness when he saw the birthday cake shaped like a toilet.

examples.sentence: His moonlighting earnings bought a PS5 every month.
TikTok creators' earnings come from virtual gifts.
Her earnings as a programmer could afford 300 stinky tofu per day.
The delivery rider checked his earnings after 100 orders.
Many families use 50% of earnings to pay mortgages.
Annual earnings of livestream stars exceed some listed companies.
Tencent's Q3 earnings report surprised investors.
During earnings season, stock prices fluctuate like crazy.
Her wireless earphones fell into the hot pot during dinner.
These noise-canceling earphones cost more than my monthly rent.
The doctor pressed the earphone closer to hear my heartbeat.
Old-fashioned telephone earphones weighed like two steamed buns.
His bluetooth earphones survived a full washing machine cycle.
Finding a phone with earphone jack is like finding a unicorn now.
The wireless earpiece fell into my spicy hotpot during dinner.
His new bone-conduction earpiece looks like a cyborg attachment.
The ski goggles come with detachable fur earpieces.
Traditional Mongolian hats often have decorative earpieces.
The optician adjusted the earpieces to fit my big head.
Her glasses have Hello Kitty patterns on the earpieces.
Delivery drivers often use bluetooth earpieces to take orders.
The DJ wore neon earplugs that glowed in the dark club.
I always carry panda-shaped earplugs for sudden construction noise.
The factory provides free foam earplugs shaped like tiny mushrooms.

examples.sentence: Her jade earrings clinked when she shook her head during the mahjong game.
The Forbidden City exhibition features ancient earrings shaped like phoenixes.
Modern earrings include magnetic ones for people afraid of piercings.
During Tang Dynasty, earrings were status symbols heavier than smartphones.
She lost one of her pearl earrings while riding a shared bike.
The secret recipe was discussed within earshot of rival chefs.
Keep your gossip out of grandma's earshot unless you want it broadcasted.
The fog reduced our earshot to just 10 meters.
Elephants communicate at earshots exceeding 5 kilometers.
The kindergarten teacher stayed within earshot of playing children.
The first photo of Earth from space changed human perspective forever.
Earth's population would fill 7,000 Great Pyramids of Giza.
The pottery teacher said we must respect the earth as living material.
After rain, the smell of fresh earth reminds me of childhood.
His invention shook the literary earth like a quake.
The news traveled to every corner of the earth via Weibo.
Buddhist monks strive to transcend earthly desires.
We earthed the time capsule under the school's flagpole.
The gardener earthed up the rose bushes for winter protection.
The fox earthed swiftly when hearing hunters.
Why on earth would anyone queue 5 hours for milk tea?
The billionaire stays down to earth by taking the subway daily.
The Mars rover left earthbound control behind forever.
Earthbound telescopes can't observe dark matter directly.
Pandas are earthbound creatures unlike squirrels.
The earthbound missile couldn't hit the helicopter.
His earthbound desires include hotpot and lottery.
Monks try to transcend earthbound temptations.
The earthbound design looked like a concrete box.
Her earthbound cooking never experiments with flavors.
The Great Wall's earthen sections need special protection from rain.
Children built an earthen castle in the yard after the rain.
Terracotta Warriors are famous earthen sculptures from 2000 years ago.
She collects earthen teapots from different dynasties.
The museum displays Tang Dynasty earthenware with camel designs.
Her grandma still uses earthenware pots to pickle vegetables.
Archaeologists found primitive earthenware in the Neolithic site.
The earthenware whistle mimics birdsong when filled with water.
The earthenware jar kept tea leaves dry for months.
The earthiness of this porcelain comes from special clay in Jingdezhen.
Wine experts can detect the earthiness of French vineyards in each sip.
The earthiness of Tibetan barley makes it perfect for high-altitude growth.
Farmers praise the earthiness of this fertilizer as 'the taste of soil'.
The earthiness of his humor shocked the aristocratic guests.
Ancient peasant paintings charm us with their intentional earthiness.
The earthiness of her cooking reminds me of grandma's kitchen.
His songs gained popularity through their earthy earthiness.
In sci-fi films, aliens often say 'Take me to your leader, earthling!'
The museum displayed how earthlings wasted natural resources.
As a mere earthling, I can't resist spicy hotpot.
The monk smiled at our earthling worries about likes on Weibo.
He called luxury bags 'useless earthlings' status symbols.
Stop collecting these material earthlings and read some poetry!
The earthly paradise described in the book turns out to be Zhangjiajie.
Astronauts say earthly blue is the most beautiful color in space.
He gave up all earthly possessions to become a monk at Shaolin Temple.
The movie shows how an earthly love story can be magical.
There's no earthly reason why bubble tea shouldn't be a breakfast option.
With your talent, there's no earthly way you'll fail the exam.
His only earthly possessions are a smartphone and a metro card.
There's no earthly reason to ban spicy hotpot.

examples.sentence: The Tangshan earthquake in 1976 remains one of the deadliest in history.
Modern buildings in Tokyo are designed to withstand strong earthquakes.
The Pacific Rim is the most active earthquake zone in the world.
Japanese schools conduct monthly earthquake drills like fire drills.
The Great Wall's earthwork sections were built with rammed soil layers.
Archaeologists found ancient earthwork defenses dating back to the Warring States period.
The subway construction requires massive earthwork to dig tunnels.
Modern earthwork machinery can move hills within days.

teach: earthworkæ˜¯åŸºå»ºç‹‚é­”çš„ç¥–ä¼ æ‰‹è‰ºğŸ—ï¸ï¼å¤ä»£ç‰ˆ'æ„šå…¬ç§»å±±'å°±æ˜¯äººåŠ›earthworkâ›ï¸ï¼Œç°åœ¨å˜æˆ'è“ç¿”æ¯•ä¸šç­'çš„æŒ–æ˜æœºç§€ğŸ¤–ã€‚è¯´'å¤§å…´åœŸæœ¨'ç”¨break groundï¼ˆç ´åœŸï¼‰ï¼Œ'æŒ–åœŸæ–¹'å«cut-and-fill like a terraforming gameğŸ®ã€‚è®°ä½ï¼šä½ çš„å¿«é€’èƒ½æ¬¡æ—¥è¾¾ï¼Œå…¨é earthworké“ºè·¯ï¼

examples.sentence: The earthworm wriggled out after the rain like a tiny dragon.
Charles Darwin studied earthworms for 39 years and called them 'nature's plows'.
Organic farmers treasure earthworm castings more than gold.
The farmer's hands had an earthy smell after planting potatoes.
This ceramic mug has an earthy texture that reminds me of childhood in the countryside.
The earthy flavor of beetroot comes from geosmin, a compound produced by soil bacteria.
Pu'er tea's earthy taste is highly prized by connoisseurs.
His earthy jokes about rural life always make the villagers roar with laughter.
The douyin video went viral for its earthy but heartwarming proposal style.
Comedians in nightclubs often use earthy humor involving toilet jokes.
Her autumn collection features earthy colors like ochre and burnt sienna.
The earwig curled its pincers when I touched the flower pot.
Ancient medical texts falsely claimed earwigs could crawl into brains.

usages.form: like an earwig in the ear

examples.sentence: His complaints stuck in my mind like an earwig in the ear.
The panda lives in perfect ease while rolling down the hill.
Grandma's face showed ease when smelling osmanthus flowers.
We drank bubble tea with great ease by the West Lake.
His life of ease includes daily mahjong games.
Hotpot eases the winter chill in Beijing.
The doctor eased his pain with acupuncture.
She eased the rope to let the kite fly higher.
Massage eased my tense shoulders after coding.
The dancer eases between the crowd like a dragon.
The shared bike eases through Beijing's hutongs.
I feel at ease when eating spicy crayfish.
The rain eased off just before the marathon.
Van Gogh's sunflower paintings wobbled on his rickety easel.
The art student forgot her easel at the subway station.
